ab1.l: First, the nērang for cutting the barsom.

div.ab1: nazdik-deraḫt gaz nabāšad anār nīz šāyad va haft šāḫ-e barsom pāk kardan va pas kosti nō kardan va fanām-e (?) moḥkam bastan va xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū yek ḫvāndan

(He goes) to a next tree. The tamarisk-tree is not allowed, but the pomegranate-tree is. He purifies seven branches of the barsom and then puts a new kostī and ties the girdle firmly. Then he has to recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū.
va mašrabe-ye āb bar dāštan va āb az mašrabe-ye bozorg be mašrabe-ye ḫord riḫtan tā porr šavad tā yek-pāre niz foru rizad va digar bāre xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū yek ḫvāndan

He has to raise the vessel for the water and pour the water from the big vessel into the small one until it is full and and a bit of water overflows." Then he has to recite xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and one Aṣ̌əm Vohū.

va se bār āb az mašrabe-ye bozorg dar mašrabe-ye ḫord riḫtan va niku āb rā eḥtyāṭ yek zarre az mašrabe-ye ḫord dar mašrabe-ye bozorg riḫtan bār-e avval be-vāǧ guftan ke yōzdāṯare zereh-ye farākard va bār-e dovvom be-vāǧ guftan ke yōzdāṯare zereh-ye vurkaš bār-e šeivom be-vāǧ guftan ke yōzdāṯare zereh-ye *pūiti harvisb minuy-e arvīsūr āb-e pāk-e yōzdāṯare pas in-rā āb-e pādyāvi guyand pas har do dast barsom-čin b-ān āb šostan yek šāḫ-e barsom be-dast-e rāst be-gereftan va sar-aš be-daste-čab va barsom-čin be-gereftan va se bār namāz bordan pas xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aṣ̌əm vohū 3

He has to pour three times water from the big vessel into the small vessel and then a bit of water from the small vessel into the big vessel. The first time while saying the wāz : yōzdāṯare zereh-ye farākard. The second time while saying the wāz: yōzdāṯare zereh-ye vurkaš. The third time, saying the vāz: yōzdāṯare zereh-ye pūiti harvisb minuy-e arvīsūr āb-e pāk-e yōzdāṯare. Then, they determine it as pure water. Afterwards, he has to wash his two hands and the barsom-čin with this water, to take a branch of the barsom with the right hand and to take its end with the left hand and the barsom-čin. He has to bring namāz three times nd to recite then xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā and three Aṣ̌əm Vohū.
urvar va dār va deraḫt tamām be-negarand
He examines completely the plant, the wood and the three.

va be aṣ̌əm sar-e šāḫ-e barsom boridan va meqdār-e ēk dāne-e ǧou dur afgandan pas vohū barsom-čin bar miyān-e barsom nihādan pas vahištəm teke-ye barsom boridan pas astī uštā astī uštā. am̦āi. tā sar ḫvāndan se šāḫ-e barsom b-in dastur āvāyad čidan pas har čand ke xāhand činand hame-rā yek-yek bar āvāyad boridan hame-rā yek-yek sar āvāyad boridan meqdār-e yek dāne-ye ǧou vaqt šomordan mi-vāyad ke ǧoft ǧoft šomārand dar āxari yeki ke ṭāq bāšad agar ǧoft bāšad yeki digar čidan pas aivanghan be-hamin vāǧ bečinand ke aivanghan vāǧ gīrišn nadārad va pas be-hamān šāḫ-e barsom āyand ke vāǧ gerefte bāšand vāǧ be-guyand

At aṣ̌əm he cuts the end of the barsom-twig and he throws it away (as) a corn of barley. Then (at) vohū he puts the barsom-čin in the middle of the barsom. Then at vahištəm he cuts a piece of the barsom and then recites astī uštā astī uštā am̦āi upto the end. He must cut in this way (at least) three twigs of the barsom. Then he must cut twig by twig as many twigs as they want to cut. He must cut the end of all branches, one to one, in the size of a wheat corn. When the count, they should count by pairs. Eventually, it must be a single piece. If they are pairs, then another one should be cut. Afterwards, they cut the aivanghan with even the same vāǧ. If there is not vāǧ-gīrišn for the aivanghan, then they go to exactly the branch of the barsom at which they mihght have taken the vāǧ and say the vāǧ.

pas aivanghan čidan barsom va aivanghan va barsom post va se tā andar barsomdān pādyāvi kardan yaʿni se bār andar āb kardan va šostan pas barsom andar u kardan andar yašt xāne bordan va moḥkam nahādan pas dur āmadan

Then, the has to cut the aivyanghan. He pas to wash with pādyāb the barsom, the aivanghan, the back of the barsom and the three pieces in the barsom-dān. That means: he has to put them three times in the water and wash them. Them he puts the barsom on it and bring it to the yašt xāne and goes away.

agar aivyanghan ǧā-ye digar bud vāǧ-e barsom guftan va barsomdān dur nahādan va pas ahmāi raesca tā sar va hazaŋhrəm tā sar va jasamē tā sar ḫvāndan pas digar bār xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ aš̱əm vōhū se ḫvāndan barsom va barsomdām va āb bar dāštan va nazdik-e aivanghan šodan va aivanghan az har deraḫt-e sabz šāyad elā nār va gaz našāyad va digar dast b-āb pādyāvi šostan barsom az barsomdān bedar kardan va dar dast gereftan pas be-kārd-e barsom-čin aivanghan čidan ba hǐč čiz našāyad ḫvāndan va ān ašem vohu ke šomā neveste budid niz navāyad ḫvāndan va barsom be-dast našāyad čidan barsom šab našāyad čidan va ān xšaθrahe vairiiehe ke šoma nevešte budid niz nabāyad ḫvāndan ke barsom bandand se tā yā panǧ tā yā hafta tā barsom va aivanghan dar dast gereftan čenān konand ke dast-e čab az barsom ǧodā nabāšad

If the aivanghan was at a different place, he has to recite again the vāǧ for the barsom and to put the barsom-dān far away. Then, he has to recite ahmāi. raesca till the end and jasa.me till the end. Then he has to recite again xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three Aṣ̌əm Vohū. He has to raise the barsom, the barsom-dān and the water and go near the aivanghan. The aivanghan can be from any fruti tree, but pomegranate and tamarisk are not allowed. He has to wash the other hand with pādyāb and to remove the barsom from the barsom-dānand to take it with the hand and then to cut the aivanghan with the knife of the barsom-čin. It is not allowed to recite anything else. It is not allowed to recite the Aṣ̌əm Vohī that you have written. It is also not allowed to recite the xšaθrahe vairiiehe that you have written. The ones who tie the barsom, they have to take three, five, seven branches of the barsom and the aivanghan in the right hand and the make so that the left hand get not separated from the barsom
